com.xatkit.plugins.telegram.platform.action

Class Reply

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.xatkit.core.platform.action.RuntimeAction<T>
      • com.xatkit.core.platform.action.RuntimeArtifactAction<T>
        • com.xatkit.core.platform.action.RuntimeMessageAction<TelegramPlatform>
          • com.xatkit.plugins.telegram.platform.action.PostMessage
            • com.xatkit.plugins.telegram.platform.action.Reply
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.util.concurrent.Callable<com.xatkit.core.platform.action.RuntimeActionResult>

    public class Reply
extends PostMessage
    A RuntimeMessageAction that replies to a message using the input telegram channel.

    This action relies on the provided StateContext to retrieve the channel associated to the user input (i.e. the chatId identifier).

    See Also:
    PostMessage

        Constructs a new Reply with the provided reactPlatform, session, and message.

        This constructor is similar to new Reply(runtimePlatform, session, message, Collections.emptyList()).

        Parameters:
        platform - the TelegramPlatform containing this action
        context - the StateContext associated to this action
        message - the message to post

        Constructs a new Reply with the provided reactPlatform, session, buttons, and message.
        Parameters:
        platform - the TelegramPlatform containing this action
        context - the StateContext associated to this action
        message - the message to post
        buttons - the quick message buttons to display with the message
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the provided platform or context is null
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the provided message is null or empty
        See Also:
        getChannel(StateContext), PostMessage

    • Method Detail

      • getChannel

        public static java.lang.String getChannel(@NonNull
                                          @NonNull com.xatkit.execution.StateContext context)
        Returns the channel associated to the user input.

        This method searches for the value stored with the ChatUtils.CHAT_CHANNEL_CONTEXT_KEY key in the platform data of the current EventInstance.

        Parameters:
        context - the StateContext to retrieve the channel from
        Returns:
        the channel associated to the user input
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the provided context is null, or if it does not contain the channel information
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the retrieved channel is not a String
        See Also:
        StateContext.getEventInstance(), EventInstance.getPlatformData()
